page.title: 04Old Longnor
page.content: Longnor is an old village. It has 4 pubs and 2 cafes. In the olden days it had about 12 pubs. Longnor has a few historical buildings such as the church and town hall which is set on the cobbled market place. The town hall has been repaired. Longnor was said to be the smallest town in England. In the eighteenth century the church was burnt down but it is now rebuilt. Longnor is supposed to be haunted by ghosts. People say that the headless horseman haunts the streets of Longnor and also Hollinsclough. There is supposed to be the ghost of the black dog roaming Mill Lane. Longnor has an old saw mill which in the olden days was set on fire. The blame was put on some gypsies in the nearby field.
